member.name: T:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer
member.summary: Interface for the player class. This defines the methods and properties a player object should implement to interact with Pokémon and battle mechanics.

member.name: P:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the player.

member.name: P:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.Pokemons
member.summary: A list containing all the player's Pokémon.

member.name: P:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.Cementerio
member.summary: A list of all the Pokémon that are out of battle (i.e., "dead" or not active).

member.name: P:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.Items
member.summary: A list containing all the player's items (potions, revival items, etc.). This list is updated during the battle as items are used or removed.

member.name: P:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.SelectedPokemon
member.summary: The current selected Pokémon of the player.

member.name: P:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.Turn
member.summary: The current turn of the player, used for attack cooldown.

member.name: M:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.SwitchPokemon(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the selected Pokémon for a new one based on the player's choice.
member.param: The index of the new Pokémon selected from the player's Pokémon list.

member.name: M:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.CarryToCementerio
member.summary: Moves the currently "dead" Pokémon to the cemetery list of Pokémon that are no longer in battle. This method is called when a Pokémon is fainted.

member.name: M:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the item from the player's item list based on the provided index.
member.param: The index of the item in the list to be retrieved.
member.returns: The item corresponding to the provided index.

member.name: M:Library.Game.Players.IPlayer.RemoveItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the item from the player's item list based on the provided index.
member.param: The index of the item in the list to be removed.

member.summary: This class has the responsibilities of making calculations, these being: - Index in range - Approving of inputs - Damage calculations

member.summary: Method that returns the numeric percentage of boost (or not) that the attack has on the opponent.

member.summary: Checks for effectiveness in the attack received. It compares the attack type to the Pokémon type and returns a double value for the effectiveness.

member.name: M:Library.Game.Utilities.Calculator.ValidateSelectionInGivenRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Function to validate that a number is in between two given values and checks if the input is an integer. This function also reads the number inputted, this is so that the 'asking' and the 'validation' can happen in the same line.

The Pokémon receiving the damage.
